text: RT @SevernUnlocked: Great to be featured in New Civil Engineer - with an article all about our engineering challenges and solutions for #Fi‚Ä¶

@TaverhamMill @EnvAgency Thanks for reporting this- it is terrible that it is still flowing into the river. It is constant and now coating the vegetation as the river level falls.

@razor_grinder @chelseabirder @EnvAgencySE I believe it was coming from a drain at the end of the rugby fields. The EA put a boom bar round it on Christmas Eve, but was leaking again by New Years Day‚òπÔ∏è

text: @Nick_Everard @metoffice @EnvAgencyNW An interesting subject. We have 2 manual gauges around 650m on Helvellyn, significantly higher than Honister at 358m, yet their LTAs are considerably less. urls.title: The greenhouse effect is a bad explanation of the temperature in the atmosphere.
urls.description: The greenhouse effect is a bad explanation of the temperature in the atmosphere. Author; Rogelio Perez C Summary; According to the greenhouse effect theory, temperature in the atmosphere is caused by heat emitted by atoms on the earth's surface, which is absorbed, retained and irradiated in all directions by certain special gases in the atmosphere, known as greenhouse gases. The problem with the greenhouse effect theory is that the science that explains heat and temperature for any system in the universe,

text:
@EmmaHowardBoyd @Grantham_IC @COP26 @EnvAgency @ClintonDevon @johnvarley @annietrev @WRIClimate @GCAdaptation @CASsummit2021 @AdaptOurWorld Greenhouse effect is a false explanation of the temperature in atmosphere.#nomoredeception

The temperature in atmosphere is obtained from measuring the kinetic energy (movements) of all molecules in it. 

Greenhouse gases is only 0.04% of the atmosphere.

https://t.co/6U0zAg9nHC https://t.co/r27IQnhk7S

text: @EnvAgencyAnglia @Ben_garrod @EnvAgency @MikeLiggins @EDP24 @BBCLookEast @BBCNorfolk @NorfolkCC Great. Why is the flow still so bad?
River bank clean along the Jubilee river this morning .#litterpick #lovewhereyoulive #makeadifference #bethechange  @CleanJRnow @EnvAgency https://t.co/FMMDcX4YET

@Ben_garrod @EnvAgency @MikeLiggins @EDP24 @BBCLookEast @BBCNorfolk @NorfolkCC We're aware of this incident and have been monitoring the situation. A team of specialists are due on site today to clear it up.  At this time no fish seem to have been affected. We'll be taking further samples to check invertebrates.
